moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 Qxd5 4. Nc3 Qd: All the games start here. The Grand Prix Attack is a lot of things, but "boring" isn't one of them.
moves.8. d3 Bg4 9. h3 Bxf3 10. Qxf3: The game is already getting interesting. My opponent has elected to exchange minor pieces on KB6. As a result of the exchange, I now have a threat to win a Pawn by 11 BxN ch PxB 12 QxP ch.
moves.10... Qd6: Black defends the threat and centralizes the Queen nicely.
moves.13. Bxc6 bxc6: Both Kings are now somewhat exposed.
moves.14. Na4 Qd4+: With this nice tactical shot, Black wins a piece.
moves.15. Kh2 Qxa4 16. b3 Qb5 17. c4: I hasten to force Black's Queen away from the action.
moves.17... Qb7 18. Ba5 Re8 19. Rfe1 e6 20. Re: I haven't given up hope. Despite being a piece down, there is enough wood left on the board to provoke complications.
moves.22... h5 23. Bxf6: ...and it works. Just as I overlooked a piece capture earlier, Black overlooks this equalizer.
All the minor pieces are gone. I feel I have a decent shot in the all-heavy-piece end game due to my better Q-side Pawn position.
moves.26... Qb8 27. Red1 Qd6 28. Rd2 e5 29. fx: I exploit the weakened Black Q-side by winning a Pawn with tempo.
moves.30... Kd8 31. Qe4: Now ahead in material, I look to simplify by removing the Queens. My opponent accedes.
moves.31... Qxe4 32. dxe4+ Kc8 33. Re1: I am a Pawn ahead, but winning won't be easy. I will need to centralize my King and keep my Rooks mobile.
moves.33... Kb7 34. Rd5 Kc6 35. e5 f6 36. Rd6+: Now I'm two pawns up and have a passed KP. I feel my chances have improved significantly.
moves.37... a5 38. Ra6 Kb7 39. Rxa5: Now I have a second passed Pawn.
moves.39... Kc6 40. a3 Kb6 41. b4 cxb4 42. axb: With connected passed Q-side Pawns, it's a matter of technique now.
moves.51... Kd5 52. Rbe1 Rb3 53. Re1e3 Rxe3 54: I was expecting 55... KxR, to which the response would be 56 K-N5 eliminating the last Black Pawn.
moves.55... Kc4 56. c6 Kxb4 57. c7: For some reason Black chose not to capture my Rook, which simply made matters easier. Black resigns here.
